item.description:
This is part of the Wadsworth's summer film series, "The Best of the Fests." If you missed seeing something during one of the film festivals in the last year, here is a second chance. Many of the films are shown more than once, so if you are interested but cannot make this time, check their website for additional dates and times.

"Inside Hana's Suitcase"
Sunday Jun 20, 10
4 p.m. - 5:30 p.m.
2009. Canada. 88 min. Rated PG.
Documentary. Directed by Larry Weinstein.

This film investigates the details behind the noted 2002 book "Hana’s Suitcase". Fumiko Ishioka, director of the Tokyo Holocaust Education Resource Center, acquires a Czech Jewish girl’s suitcase, retrieved from a Nazi death camp over 60 years earlier and preserved as part of a Holocaust memorial. Curiosity turns to emotional investment as Ishioka researches the suitcase owner’s fate.

This is the Hartford Premiere of this movie.

NOTE: There is another movie at 2:00pm which is set as a different Meetup. Choose one or both on this day.
item.how_to_find_us: In the Aetna Theater lobby before the movie. I will have a shawl.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "Inside Hanna's Suitcase" @ Wadsworth Atheneum
